moves.1. e4 c5 2. c4 Nc6 3. Nf3 g6 4. Nc3 Bg7: ..thought this to be too early..Be2 seems natural, so i gain a tempo with the next move.
moves.5... e6 6. Nf4 Nge7 7. Bd3: ..this cramps white and is now a target, black just needs to keep development moving...
moves.7... d6 8. O-O Qc7 9. Qa4: ..thought this was wasting time..needed to activate more pieces...i.e black bishop, Rf1 or prepare for longer f4
moves.10. Qc2 Nb4 11. Qb3 d5: No need to take the bishop now, gain time and pressure the centre.
moves.12. a3 Nxd3 13. Qxd3: mistake...should be Nxd3, white drops a piece.
moves.13... Qxf4 14. e5 O-O 15. Qe2 Qxc4: ..swop Q's and head for end game...
moves.16. d3 Qa6 17. Be3 Bb5 18. Rfd1 d4 19. B: ..white needed to get rid of pin..maybe Ne1 first
..i want to force off pieces as i am a piece up...
moves.24. gxf3 Qxd2 25. Bxd2 Bxe5 26. h3 d3 27: ..i can afford the exchange down..and it also removes another piece
moves.29. Rxd2: ....white is lost completely with the skewer Bc3, white can resign.
moves.29... Bc3 30. Rd3 Bxa5 31. f4 Rfd8 32. B: ..at last, an opportunity to quickly force off more material if not end the game with a mating threat.
moves.35. Kh2 g5 36. Rb3 Rd3 37. Rxb7 Rxh3+ 38: ..white is 3 pieces down and mate threatened...
